intro: Thrixspermum annamense, commonly known as the Annamese thrixspermum, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy stems and broad, ovate leaves. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Thrixspermum annamense is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
